intro: Scolopia novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by colorful bracts that enhance its ornamental value. Scolopia novoguineensis is valued in horticulture for its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid climates.
